heliolib.data_extraction_service.aws_timestream_extraction.timestream_data_extraction module

class heliolib.data_extraction_service.aws_timestream_extraction.timestream_data_extraction.TimestreamDataExtractor(aws_timestream_client, plant_id, metadata_api_object, boto3_session=None, inv_ids=None, mppt_ids=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for extracting data from AWS TimestreamDB.

This class provides methods to fetch data from a Timestream database using aws timestream client for a specific date range, and for specific identifiers like inverter IDs (inv_ids) and MPPT IDs (mppt_ids).

Parameters:

aws_timestream_clientAWS Wrangler Timestream client

The AWS Wrangler Timestream client to use for Timestream DB queries, e.g. awswrangler.timestream.

plant_idint

The ID of the plant.

metadata_api_objectMetadataAPI object

The MetadataAPI object to use for fetching company name. metadata_api_object = MetadataAPI()

boto3_sessionboto3.Session, optional

The AWS boto session to use for Timestream DB queries. If not provided, a session will be initialized using the AWS_REGION environment variable. If AWS_REGION is not set in the environment, an error will be raised.

inv_idslist[str], optional

List of inverter IDs.

mppt_idslist[str], optional

List of MPPT IDs.

Methods:

fetch_data(start_datetime, end_datetime)pandas.DataFrame

Fetches data from Timestream for the specified date range.

Examples:

import awswrangler as wr

aws_timestream_client = wr.timestream plant_id = 123 metadata_api_object = MetadataAPI() boto3_session = boto3.Session(region_name=”eu-west-1”) inv_ids = [“1”, “2”] mppt_ids = [“1”, “2”] start_datetime = datetime(2021, 1, 1) end_datetime = datetime(2021, 1, 2) extractor = TimestreamDataExtractor(aws_timestream_client, plant_id, metadata_api_object, boto3_session, inv_ids, mppt_ids) data = extractor.fetch_data(start_datetime, end_datetime)

fetch_data(start_datetime, end_datetime)[source]

Fetches data from Timestream for the specified date range.

Parameters:

start_datetimedatetime.datetime

The start datetime for the data extraction period.

end_datetimedatetime.datetime

The end datetime for the data extraction period.

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the fetched data.

Raises:

TypeError

If start_datetime or end_datetime is not an instance of datetime.datetime.

Examples:

from datetime import datetime start_datetime = datetime(2021, 1, 1) end_datetime = datetime(2021, 1, 2) data = extractor.fetch_data(start_datetime, end_datetime)
